resources.string: Please describe your item to find a place for it.
including newsprint; ledger paper; computer paper; corrugated cardboard; and mixed paper.

including intact or repairable home or industrial appliances; household goods; clothing; intact materials in demolition debris, such as lumber; building materials such as doors, windows, cabinets, and sinks; business supplies and equipment; lighting fixtures; and any manufactured item or naturally occurring object that can be repaired or used again as is.
including both ferrous and nonferrous, including cans; parts from abandoned vehicles; plumbing; fences; metal doors and screens; tools; machinery; and any other discarded metal objects.
including glass containers and window glass.
including nonreusable clothing; upholstery; and pieces of fabric.
including beverage containers; plastic packaging; plastic cases of consumer goods such as telephones or electronic equipment; films and tires
including leaves and cuttings; trimmings from trees, shrubs, and grass; whole plants, and sawdust.
including animal, fruit, and vegetable debris; cooked food; manures; offal; and sewage sludge.
including unreusable lumber; tree rounds; and pallets.
\nincluding rock; tile; china; brick; concrete; plaster; and asphalt.
including excavation soils from barren or developed land; and excess soils from people\\'s yards.
including acids; bases; solvents; fuels; lubricating oils; and medicines.
Maximum distance to track disposal places
Receive a notification whenever a new place accepting one of your current items becomes available
Recycling turns things into other thingsâ€¦ magic!
Your feedback and concerns are important to the developer. Please write to uxcedr@gmail.com
If you are having technical difficulties or would like help with the app, try the Help section from the main screen.

RecycleDump is a location-based app linking waste disposers to collectors and disposal points. We refer to these as 'disposal opportunities'. These could be anything from scrap metal collectors and clothing bins to public skips and individuals making use of recyclables. 

Each has a classification of categories of waste it will accept. If you'd like to find a disposal opportunity for your waste items, simply add them to your library within the app. You'll then be shown the nearest points that will take your item, or be notified when such disposal opportunity becomes available. 

The real power of the app is linking together producers and consumers of waste, facilitating a more efficient waste collection system for everyone.
I just want to get rid of something, what do I do?

Head to the main screen and select the green 'Dispose of something' button. Then, choose whether you want to recycle or dump your item. 

Fill out the details of your item, most importantly the category so we can match you to the appropriate locations. 

Once you've saved your item head to your items library from the side menu on the left, where your item should be displayed. By clicking on its cell, you can check the map for surrounding locations/collectors that accept your item. 

It's no problem if there are no disposal opportunities initially, we'll notify you as soon as one comes up.
Where does the disposal opportunity data come from?

Details of locations and collectors are contributed to the app in one of two ways: 

1. Us obtaining data directly from local councils and pulling it from location-based networks such as Neighbourly. 

2. Private collectors of waste/recyclables can upload their information through the app, as well as users who have found useful disposal opportunities themselves. This option enables a truly collaborative approach to recycling and waste management.
Future releases will focus on collectors and locations; letting them create and manage their disposal opportunity. If you are such a user, you\'ll have access to fine-grained control of your listing.
Can you dump or recycle here?
What types of item does this place accept?
